intro: Coussarea macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaved coussarea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its large, glossy, elliptical leaves that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. It produces clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in the summer months. The fruit is a small, yellowish drupe that contains a single seed.
